summary: Add a method for workflows to wait for all handlers to complete before continuing as new or exiting. Users need explicit control over handler cleanup when transitioning workflow state.
userImpact: Users cannot reliably ensure all handlers complete their work when continuing as new or exiting workflows, potentially losing work or causing resource leaks.
proposedFix: Implement a method (similar to .NET SDK issue #261) that allows workflows to explicitly wait for handlers to finish.
resolutionDetails: Feature was implemented to provide a method for waiting on handler completion.
keyQuote: Users want to easily await (or ignore) all their remaining handlers when they continue as new or exit the workflow.
